intro: Xanthocephalum gymnospermoides subsp. gymnospermoides, commonly known as the narrowleaf sandmat, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It has fibrous roots and is often found in coastal or inland dunes. The subspecies is distinguished by its narrow leaves and is used in traditional medicine by some Indigenous Australian communities.
